text: Tribute to Jerusalem is a permanent sculpture in Holland Square, near Mount Herzl in Jerusalem. It is at the corner of Kiryat Yovel Street and Ein Karem. The sculpture's popular nickname is "the red sculpture". The sculpture stands at a view point overlooking the Jerusalem Forest and Ein Kerem. The sculpture was made in 1977 by Alexander Calder. == Other websites == Category:Sculptures Category:Monuments and memorials in Jerusalem Category:1977 works Category:1970s in art
title: Tribute to Jerusalem
